The problem with URL compactors like TinyUrl is that you do not know
where the short URL actually brings you to.  If the tiny URL comes from
a trusted person, it is a perfect tool.

 

What usually also works is to embed the long URL into brackets "<" and
">".

 

Andreas

> in a manner where the link isn't broken.

You should try tinyurl.com. They now have a script you can drag to your 
browser's bookmark bar, so when you're on a site, you can immediately 
translate the URL into something short and postable. I find the tool 
very handy.
